meanings.definition: To seal (a bottle) with a new cork.
meanings.sent1: She recorked the wine bottle after pouring a glass.
meanings.sent2: After the party, he recorked the champagne bottle to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent3: The magician recorked the bottle and made it disappear!
meanings.sent4: He recorked his emotions, hiding them away like a sealed bottle.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bottle being recorked echoed in the room.

meanings.definition: To close (a bottle) with a cork again.
meanings.sent1: They recorked the olive oil bottle to prevent spills.
meanings.sent2: The bartender recorked the whiskey bottle after pouring a drink.
meanings.sent3: The chef recorked the vinegar bottle, trying to trap the genie back in.
meanings.sent4: She recorked her memories, hoping to keep them preserved like a vintage wine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bottle being recorked signaled the end of the celebration.
